data_handling.data_generation module¶

data_handling.data_generation.data_generation(file_name: str, constellation_name: str, num_orbits: int, num_sats_per_orbit: int, inclination_degree: float, mean_motion_rev_per_day, phase_diff=True, eccentricity=1e-07, arg_of_perigee_degree=0.0)[source]¶

Function calls on Hypatia function to build physical description of satellite network using TLE coordinate system and stores description in temporary file. Orbit eccentricity must be > 0 (according to Hypatia) - set close to 0 to ensure orbit is approx. circular.

Parameters

  • file_name – the name of the file that holds the TLE description of all satellites within the network

  • constellation_name – name of satellite network constellation, e.g. Starlink-550

  • num_orbits – the number of orbits (i.e. orbital paths) of satellites within the network

  • num_sats_per_orbit – the number of satellites per orbit

  • inclination_degree – the inclination degree (“angle of orbit”) of the satellite network

  • mean_motion_rev_per_day – the number of orbits of Earth each satellite completes per day

  • phase_diff – the difference in phase between satellites in adjacent orbits

  • eccentricity – the eccentricity of the orbit - assume orbits are circular as default

  • arg_of_perigee_degree – point in orbit at which satellite gets closest to Earth

Returns

LEO_Satellite_Network_Topology_Design
